greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d in D(n)} 2^d, where D(n) = set of digits of n in decimal representation.
comment: For bitwise logical operations AND and OR:
a(m) = (a(m) AND a(n)) iff D(m) is a subset of D(n),
(a(m) AND a(n)) = 0 iff D(m) and D(n) are disjoint,
a(m) = (a(m) OR a(n)) iff D(n) is a subset of D(m),
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: A086066 := proc(n) local d: if(n=0)then return 1: fi: d:=convert(convert(n,base,10),set): return add(2^d[j],j=1..nops(d)): end: seq(A086066(n),n=0..64); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, May 31 2011
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 08 2003
